Job Position: Project Management Associate
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary / Role Description


	This is a full-time, on-site role located in Abuja for a project management associate.
	We are seeking a highly resourceful, organized and detail oriented individual, capable of initiating, planning and managing projects in alignment with broad organizational goals and business impact.
	The role requires strong research analytical skills, including tasks like gathering information, creating documentation, and supporting the team with report/proposal/grant writing and development of project plans.
	The role involves the creation of workflows, task definition and development of high-level, detailed timelines and project plans.
	Must have the ability to multi-task, strong communication and a research driven mindset.
	The associate will be responsible for office management operations and administrative functions
	Work closely with senior team members to ensure accurate and efficient execution of projects and contribute to the overall success of the firm strategies.


Key Responsibilities


	Carry out market research, business intelligence, (qualitative and quantitative research) on industry trends, markets, and competitors.
	Project Planning and Execution
	Monitoring Project Performance: Tracking key performance indicators (KPIs),
	Document Management: Maintaining project documentation, including meeting minutes, reports, and other essential records.
	Communication and Coordination: Facilitating communication between team members and stakeholders, ensuring information flows effectively.
	Financial planning and budgeting
	Fundraising/Grant Sourcing
	Grant writing /proposal writing
	Business plan writing
	Strategic partnerships /Stakeholder engagement
	Technical support for tender and proposal preparation
	Develop SOP&rsquo;s, KPI&rsquo;s, Staff Management.


Qualifications


	Bachelors Degree in Social Sciences,Business Administration, Economics or a related field. (Preferred; MBA)
	Certifications: (Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus) CAPM.


Skills and Qualifications:


	Minimum 5 years in a project management role
	Basic understanding of project management methodologies: Capable of using Project Management ERP solution. Knowledge of Agile or Waterfall frameworks is helpful.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills:
	Organizational and time management skills : experienced in administrative support and/or research analysis.
	Proficiency in relevant project management software (e.g., Jira, Asana,Trello Microsoft Project) can be beneficial.

	Highly skilled in using Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, Google workspace, Canva.


Key Competency:


	Critical thinking and Problem solving, Digital Skills and Grant writing skills.


Salary
Commensurate with experience.

Project Management Associate Job at Learning Gate Limited




        
    

        
        The Learning Gate (TLG) is a Consulting Firm that enables SMEs and big corporations, governments, development partners and others leverage on the firm’s experience in launching products and executing successful programs in the Nigerian technology , agriculture and education sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Management Associate
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary / Role Description
     

            
    




	This is a full-time, on-site role located in Abuja for a project management associate.
	We are seeking a highly resourceful, organized and detail oriented individual, capable of initiating, planning and managing projects in alignment with broad organizational goals and business impact.
	The role requires strong research analytical skills, including tasks like gathering information, creating documentation, and supporting the team with report/proposal/grant writing and development of project plans.
	The role involves the creation of workflows, task definition and development of high-level, detailed timelines and project plans.
	Must have the ability to multi-task, strong communication and a research driven mindset.
	The associate will be responsible for office management operations and administrative functions
	Work closely with senior team members to ensure accurate and efficient execution of projects and contribute to the overall success of the firm strategies.


Key Responsibilities


	Carry out market research, business intelligence, (qualitative and quantitative research) on industry trends, markets, and competitors.
	Project Planning and Execution
	Monitoring Project Performance: Tracking key performance indicators (KPIs),
	Document Management: Maintaining project documentation, including meeting minutes, reports, and other essential records.
	Communication and Coordination: Facilitating communication between team members and stakeholders, ensuring information flows effectively.
	Financial planning and budgeting
	Fundraising/Grant Sourcing
	Grant writing /proposal writing
	Business plan writing
	Strategic partnerships /Stakeholder engagement
	Technical support for tender and proposal preparation
	Develop SOP’s, KPI’s, Staff Management.


Qualifications


	Bachelors Degree in Social Sciences,Business Administration, Economics or a related field. (Preferred; MBA)
	Certifications: (Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus) CAPM.


Skills and Qualifications:


	Minimum 5 years in a project management role
	Basic understanding of project management methodologies: Capable of using Project Management ERP solution. Knowledge of Agile or Waterfall frameworks is helpful.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills:
	Organizational and time management skills : experienced in administrative support and/or research analysis.
	Proficiency in relevant project management software (e.g., Jira, Asana,Trello Microsoft Project) can be beneficial.
	Familiar with statistical software (e.g., SPSS, R, Python, or Excel advanced functions)
	Highly skilled in using Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, Google workspace, Canva.


Key Competency:


	Critical thinking and Problem solving, Digital Skills and Grant writing skills.


Salary
Commensurate with experience.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should sendtheir Cover Letter and CV in PDF as a single document to: info@thelearninggateinc.com, thelearninggateinc@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: CV should be sent as an attachment.

Virtual Assistant Job at Inspire Her Afrika




        
    

        
        Inspire Her Afrika is a non-profit organization committed to raising the next generation of female African leaders by delivering a comprehensive mentorship program designed to provide personalised guidance and support to African women who are seeking to improve their skills, knowledge, and career prospects. Our vision is to be the catalyst for transformative change, we are dedicated to providing thorough mentorship and creating a safe community for African women. Our mission is to equip African women with tools to passionately pursue their dreams, cultivate their skills, and emerge as influential leaders in their respective fields. We aspire to be the foremost mentorship group for African women and to set the standard for empowering African women on their journey to success.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Virtual Assistant
Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Volunteer

Job Description


	Inspire Her Afrika is seeking ahighly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Virtual Assistantto support our day-to-day operations.
	The ideal candidate will provide administrative and organizational support to the team, ensuring smooth execution of tasks, projects, and communication.
	Email Management: This includes responding to emails and overall enquiries from internal and external individuals.
	External Liaison: Identifying and interacting with potential external partnership organisations and stakeholders to foster collaborative relationships. This includes engaging guest speakers for mastery sessions.
	Internal Liaison: This involves communication with mentees and mentors on a wide range of occasions. Including, communicating rejection, acceptance into, or withdrawal from the mentorship program
	Documentation: Ensuring that minutes of team meetings are kept.
	Event Planning: This involves creating event agendas, registration forms, feedback forms, and engagement quizzes, scheduling events on Google Calendar, and sending invitations to participants.
	Calendar Management: This involves scheduling Birthdays of mentees, mentors and team members/volunteers on google calendar as wel as team meetings.


Qualifications


	Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant, Administrative Assistant, or similar role.
	Strong organizational and time management skills.
	Proficiency with tools like Google Workspace(Docs, Sheets, Calendar), Zoom, and project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana).
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple tasks.
	Previous VA experience is helpful but not required. Alignment, commitment, and willingness to learn matter most.
